channel.title: Today I Learned
channel.description: Microblog of something technical I learned today.

item.title: ElasticSearch Clusters Balance Data
item.description: Today I added a new ElasticSearch data node to our two node cluster and was pleasantly surprised when disk usage on the original two nodes dropped by a third. Turns out ElasticSearch distributes shards across all the data nodes. Very cool!

item.title: Oh-my-zsh OS X Plugin
item.description: The osx oh-my-zsh plugin unlocks a number of useful features ways of interacting with Finder from the terminal. My favourite is cdf to navigate to the directory the current finder window is on.

item.title: Three Steps to Be a Better Teacher
OSX Reinstall Ain't Bad
item.description: For the last few days I’ve been trying to get my iMac booting again when confronted with the White Screen of Death. Having exhausted the options, all roads led to reinstall. I bit the bullet fearing I’d have to restore my data from backups. When the install finished, I learned that OS X reinstalls only affect the OS and leave the data intact!

item.title: Chef Has a Different Gemrc
item.description: While the global /etc/gemrc configuration is standard for system installed gems, gems that come in omnibus packages like chef-client, chefdk, etc don’t respect this setting. It turns out for chef-client it’s /opt/chef/embedded/etc/gemrc.

item.title: Global Gem Configuration
item.description: When changing the gem source with gem source --add <url> it only changes in ~/.gemrc for that user, not globally. Make the change in /etc/gemrc to make it global.
